itemDescription: English poet, literary scholar and churchwoman (1931-2012)

wikipedia_page.main: Dorothea Ruth Etchells (17 April 1931 – 8 August 2012) was an English poet and college principal who spent most of her working life in the University of Durham.

response: *  2012   – Ruth Etchells, English poet and academic (b. 1931)
St John's was the first Church of England theological college to have both a lay person and a woman as principal (Ruth Etchells).
* Ruth Etchells – Principal of St John's College, Durham (1979–88)
*St John’s College - St John's College Visiting Fellowship and the Ruth Etchells Fellowship
* 8 August – Ruth Etchells, 81, poet and college principal.
*Ruth Etchells, 81, English poet and college principal.

She was born and brought up in Zambia. She studied at the University of Aberdeen, graduating with a double first undergraduate Master of Arts (MA Hons) degree in English and Religious Studies . She undertook a Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) degree in the Department of English Studies at the University of Durham, under the supervision of Ruth Etchells. Her doctoral thesis, titled "The influence of Congregationalism on the first four novels of D.H. Lawrence", was submitted in 1988.
